tool.name: Ribbon Plot
tool.description: Attribute Ribbon Plot of Clustered Samples
tool.command:
ribbonPlot.R #if str($CommunityFile).strip() != "": --CommunityFile="$CommunityFile" #end if #if str($Attributes).strip() != "": --Attributes="$Attributes" #end if #if str($ClusteringAlgorithm).strip() != "": --ClusteringAlgorithm="$ClusteringAlgorithm" #end if #if str($OutputFile).strip() != "": --OutputFile="$OutputFile" #end if
2>&1

param.name: Attributes
param.help: Comma-separated names of SamplesFile columns on which ribbons are to be plotted. Samples are ordered by the first element of Attributes; Attributes must identify more than 1 SampleFile column. Example: Nugent_3_group, Amsel, Nugent_Lactobacillus, pH, Clue
param.label: Attributes

param.name: ClusteringAlgorithm
param.help: Algorithm to use for clustering samples, one of "hclust" or 'DirichletMultinomial" (from the DirichletMultinomial package).
param.label: Clustering Algorithm

tool.help:
**Description**
Attributes of samples as heat maps, with samples clustered by one of several algorithms
